description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken met for two and a half hours with Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on the latest proposal for a cease-fire and hostage release. In an interview with NBC News' Andrea Mitchell, Blinken criticized Hamas for not accepting Israel's ceasefire offer, while warning against an Israeli offensive in Rafah.
title: Blinken meets with hostage families and Netanyahu in Israel

description: Two-year-old Mona Jarada and her brother Karim, who was four, were killed in an airstrike in Rafah after being forcibly displaced there by the Israeli military. Their parents were hospitalized in the same attack and so couldn’t attend their burial. “What is our guilt? That we are from Gaza?” asked the children’s grandmother through her tears.
title: ‘We are here to bury the babies’: Gazan family grieves for two young siblings

description: Thousands of protests marched in Paris on International Workers Day and called for improved labor conditions with the Olympics scheduled in the summer. NBC News’ Josh Lederman explains how activists from other causes joined in to make the protests larger and what the labor protesters are demanding.
title: Thousands of protesters march in Paris to call out labor conditions

description: British authorities have started to detain migrants in preparation for them to be sent to Rwanda in the next nine to 11 weeks, laying the groundwork for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s flagship immigration policy.
title: U.K. begins detaining migrants set to be deported to Rwanda

description: Georgia faced more protests in the capital Tbilisi as lawmakers resumed debate on controversial "foreign agents" legislation.
title: More protests in Georgia as lawmakers resume debate on 'foreign agents'

description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken told protesters in Tel Aviv that releasing Israeli hostages held by Hamas for over 200 days was "at the heart of everything we're trying to do."
title: Blinken tells Gaza hostage families to 'keep strong' as he meets them in Tel Aviv

description: More than 500 baby sea turtles were washed up on beaches by a rare and powerful storm off South Africa and rescued by members of the public.
title: Rescue effort underway after more than 500 baby sea turtles washed ashore in big storm off South Africa

description: Speaking before a meeting with the Israeli president, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said only Hamas would be responsible if there was no cease-fire in Gaza.
title: Only Hamas to blame if there's no Gaza cease-fire, Blinken says

description: A town in Japan is building a large black screen to block the view of the country’s iconic Mount Fuji, in an effort to fend off misbehaving foreign tourists.
title: To fend off tourists, a town in Japan is building a big screen blocking the view of Mount Fuji
